poem:
**Sally's Final Act**  

Sally, star-cast shadows sift,  
between roles and whispers,  
Factory echoes linger,  
Anna's tears not forgotten—  
sickle of time cuts gently.  
  
Journeyed beyond velvet drapes,  
past GoFundMe hopes, hospice sighs;  
lone spotlight fades softly now,  
footprints in film and memory,  
offstage, into night's tender arms.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sally Kirkland, Oscar-nominated actor of film and television, dies at 84 Sally Kirkland, the Oscar-nominated actor and one-time member of Andy Warhol’s the Factory, has died at 84. The star of films including Anna, JFK and Bruce Almighty had entered hospice care two days before her death after a period of ill health. Last year, a GoFundMe page had been set up to help her in the wake of “life-threatening infections” and a number of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
